subject: Re: [junit] call order on test methods
msgSnippet: ... If you let JUnit create the test suite for you by extracting the test*() methods, then you have no control over the order in which they are executed /nor
messageBody:
Claude wrote:

> Hi,
> I am using Junit 3.8.1 with WSAD 5.1
> On some workstation the test methods are called in a wrong order, i.e
> the last method of the test class is called first a.s.o. up to the
> beginning of the class.
> Did anybody already get this strange behavior?
> Is there a way, to define a parameter for that or is that a known bug?

If you let JUnit create the test suite for you by extracting the test*()
methods, then you have no control over the order in which they are
executed /nor should you want to have control/.

If you /do/ want control over the order in which tests are invoked, then
there are two options:

1. Create a custom suite() method and simply add the tests by hand.

public static Test suite() {
TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();
suite.addTest(new MyTestCase("testNumber1"));
suite.addTest(new MyTestCase("testNumber2"));
suite.addTest(new MyTestCase("testNumber3"));
return suite;
}

2. Use GSBase's (Google it) OrderedTestSuite, which allows you to choose
the order of /some/ of the tests in your TestCase class, and let others
execute in any order. This option is better if you only need to control
the order of 2 or 3 tests, but not the others.

See _JUnit Recipes_, chapter 3, for more.
